title: Longjing Green Tea
description: Premium Dragon Well green tea from Hangzhou, known for its flat appearance and sweet, delicate flavor.
longDescription: Longjing (Dragon Well) is one of China's most prestigious green teas, dating back over 1,200 years. Grown in the mountains surrounding West Lake in Hangzhou, this tea is pan-fired by hand in traditional woks to create its distinctive flat, sword-like shape. The leaves produce a clear, yellow-green infusion with a gentle, sweet aroma reminiscent of roasted chestnuts. The flavor is mellow and smooth with notes of fresh vegetables and a slight sweetness, ending with a clean finish.
brewingInstructions: Use water at 175°F (80°C). Steep for 2-3 minutes. Can be infused multiple times.

reviews.author: Tea Enthusiast
reviews.comment: Exceptional quality Dragon Well. The nutty aroma and sweet flavor are exactly what I look for in a premium Longjing.

reviews.author: Green Tea Lover
reviews.comment: Very good quality with the classic Longjing profile. Fresh harvest with vibrant flavor.

title: Da Hong Pao Oolong
description: Famous rock tea from Wuyi mountains with rich, roasted flavor and woody notes.
longDescription: Da Hong Pao (Big Red Robe) is a legendary oolong tea from the Wuyi Mountains, known for its unique mineral-rich flavor profile. The leaves are hand-picked from ancient trees that grow in rocky cliffs, which impart a distinctive 'rock taste' to the tea. The infusion is deep amber in color with a complex aroma of roasted nuts, caramel, and floral notes. The flavor is rich and full-bodied with a lingering sweetness and a hint of smokiness.
brewingInstructions: Use water at 195°F (90°C). Steep for 3-5 minutes. Can be infused multiple times.

reviews.author: Oolong Aficionado
reviews.comment: This Da Hong Pao is exceptional! The depth of flavor and complexity are unmatched. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Tea Explorer
reviews.comment: A great representation of Wuyi oolongs. Rich and satisfying with a unique mineral taste.

title: Yunnan Pu-erh
description: Aged fermented tea with earthy, smooth taste that improves with time.
longDescription: Yunnan Pu-erh is a fermented tea known for its unique aging process and complex flavor profile. The leaves are harvested from ancient tea trees in the Yunnan province and undergo a natural fermentation process that can last for years. The infusion is dark amber in color with an earthy aroma and a rich, smooth flavor that develops over time. The taste is often described as woody, musty, and slightly sweet, with a lingering finish.
brewingInstructions: Use water at 200°F (93°C). Steep for 3-5 minutes. Can be infused multiple times.
